concept.title: Mix-ins
concept.shortdesc: Mix-in modules enable the inclusion of specialized elements or attributes in specific element types.

conbody.p: Mix-in modules perform the following functions.

dlentry.dd: Mix-in modules extend content models by allowing specializations of existing elements at specific locations where their base elements are allowed. Such specialized elements must be defined in a separate domain specialization that declares the default attribute list and content model, but does not make the element available globally.

Mix-in modules modify attribute lists by adding attributes specialized from either base or props. Attribute definitions used in attribute list mix-ins can either be declared in the same module as the mix-in or as separate attribute domains.
